  • 4b61b76 Back to snapshot dep
  • c3d3d0e [maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration

  • dccb2ab 2.13.5 release
  • ca5a944 prep 2.13.5 release
  • 40e6d30 Update VERSION.md
  • 7fd470c disable tasty check for Scala 2.11/2.12 users (#611)
  • 22771c2 scala 2.3.10
  • 5d5f2f2 scala 2.3.10
  • 4e6414c upgrade to scala 2.13.9 due to cve
  • 35ffc90 Create LICENSE
  • 9a6a491 Update VERSION.md
  • 3673276 Update README.md
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Updates `jackson-datatype-jsr310` from 2.13.4 to 2.13.5 Updates `jackson-jaxrs-json-provider` from 2.13.4 to 2.13.5 Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

title: [IOTDB-5598] Pipe Plugins Management: from SQL to CN
body:
we provide the interfaces to support managing Pipe Plugins:
1.  `CREATE PIPEPLUGIN <PLUGIN-NAME> AS <FULL CLASS NAME> USING <URI>` 
2. `DROP PIPEPLUGIN <PLUGIN-NAME>`
3. `SHOW PIPEPLUGINS`

And the implements will be supported in next pr.

title: [IOTDB-5598] Manage the Jar Packages of Pipe Plugins

we provide the interfaces to support managing Pipe Plugins:
1.  `CREATE PIPEPLUGIN <PLUGIN-NAME> AS <FULL CLASS NAME> USING <URI>` 
2. `DROP PIPEPLUGIN <PLUGIN-NAME>`
3. `SHOW PIPEPLUGINS`

And the implements will be supported in next pr.

title: [To rel/1.0][IOTDB-5147]Optimize compaction schedule when priority is BALANCE
body:
### The changes in this pr are as follows:
1. Change the size of the candidateCompactionTaskQueue from 1000 to 50. The advantage is to avoid tasks blocked in the queue occupying files for a long time, resulting in no files being selected for cross-space compaction. But another impact is that once the number of files is large, because the number of tasks in the queue shrinks, the inner-space compaction will not be able to compact the latest files.
2. Priority comparison of tasks: Inner-space compaction tasks no longer distinguish between seq and unseq, but are sorted according to unified rules; under the configuration of BALANCE, cross-space compaction tasks and inner-space compaction tasks follow the first-come-first-executed rule . One thing to note is that since the priority sorting of the queue is implemented through the minimum heap sorting, and each task is not in partial order, the actual result is not strictly that the one with the smaller seriesID will be executed first.
3. Inner seq task and inner unseq task is submitted one by one, to avoid submitting too many inner seq tasks at one time, filling up the queue, resulting in no opportunity to submit inner unseq tasks.

title: [IOTDB-5594] Update timeout after completing logical plan and distribution plan
[IOTDB-5516] Fix delete schema region bug during drop database
body:
## Description

When prepare the requests for deleting schema regions, the origin implementation only deletes one replica of one raft group.

Fix this to delete all replicas.

title: [IOTDB-5594] Update timeout after completing logical plan and distribution plan
[IOTDB-5593] Improve efficiency of DistributionPlanner by recording map instead of recursive search
body: Before this pr, calculateNodeTopologyBetweenInstance() in SimpleFragmentParallelPlanner uses recursive search to locate a ExchangeNode, which is very time-consuming when PlanNodeTree is quite large. We record a map in this pr to avoid this cost. Also, we fix the issue of wrong upstreamIndex of ExchangeNode in this pr, the ITs will be added later.

body:
## Description

We use java reflections and annotation to implement SchemaRegionLoader, which brings better extension-ability for SchemaEngine.

title: [IOTDB-5555] Enable modify external RPC EndPoint of DataNode
body: The cluster DataNode is now enable to modify its clientRPCEndPoint. The [cluster Node startup protocol](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/BWAtdxAZ8oflr7xcJXncAAyAnMc) is updated for adapting this new feature. An IT is added for testing this new feature. You can find the modification result either by SQL show datanodes or in the system.properties file: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33111881/221554977-e7b1b18d-095c-4a20-9fe2-c807607ac83b.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33111881/221554988-84e5bb02-1d3c-4cf1-88d4-1ea7f30c2df9.png)

title: Fix all the charpter’s heading level,in order to adapt the pandoc
body:
version: master
change: To accommodate the formatting of pandoc when exporting to word files, replace documents that begin with a first level heading “#”with a second level heading“##”. In pandoc, the first title is identified as the chapter name, so the md file adds the chapter name to the first title

title: [To rel/1.0] Use req.getName() as templateName in ClientRpcServiceImpl
body: fix a typo

title: [IOTDB-5516] Fix DatabaseNotExistsException caused by pre deleted database during drop database
body:
## Description

During dropping database, the target database will be marked as pre-deleted in PartitionInfo, which brings DatabaseNotExistsException during adjustMaxRegionGroupNum.

Filter and ignore the pre-deleted database during adjustMaxRegionGroupNum.

title: [Draft pr] Last null cache test
[IOTDB-5586] Reduce the scope of lock in MemoryPool
body:
Every exchangeOperator will reserve or free memory in MemoryPool before adding or removing TsBlock. In condition of high concurrentcy queries or query with high dop, MemoryPool will turn into a bottleNeck.

About modification:
1. Modify the original thread-safe data structure to thread-safe data structure
2. When applying for memory, considering that most scenarios have enough memory, it is allowed to apply for memory directly. If there is insufficient memory, it is necessary to backtrack and deal with insufficient memory.

2. Remove IP and endpoint in iotdb reporter

title: [IOTDB-5584] Fix wrong intialization in GROUP BY CONDITION
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5584

When the controlColumn of first data point is false, conditon window wouldn't skip it because needSkip is intialized to false which leads to a redundant row in resultSet.

This PR fix the problem.

title: [IOTDB-5581] Missing reset of aggregators in RawDataAggregationOperator
body:
Current framework will reset aggretors when a new window is initialized.

However, if there is no more window will be initialized, the infomation in aggregator would be appended twice because it wasn't reset after last appending.

title: [IOTDB-5542] ConfigNode counter dashboard
body: Refactor and implement basic ConfigNode counter dashboard for monitoring cluster status Doc for new [monitor items](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/RqEddMeS6osuIdxmpqwcSc13nUM) **Dashboard preview:** 1. **Overview:** Cluster Nodes status and the hardware occupation of current ConfigNode 2. **ConfigNode:** The number and status history of cluster ConfigNodes 3. **DataNode:** The number and status history of cluster DataNode. Also includes Region and RegionGroup-leader distribution 4. **Database:** The number of cluster Databases. And the number of SeriesSlots, RegionGroups 5. **Region:** The number and status history of cluster Regions

title: fix-badurl-of-1.0
body:
version: rel/1.0
record：https://timechor.feishu.cn/drive/folder/fldcnOV0zj3S9g8JWspr6oDIqVf?from=from_copylink
content： Fixed the rest of the bad URL on the master branch， and added the SQL-Reference file to the official site catalogue to fix the missing file （refer to file "Reference/DML-Data-Manipulation-Language.md"）

title: Fix CI error by ignore license check for some site files
[IOTDB-4005] Allow the following child pipeline to run in advance
body:
For example, DeviceViewOperator - [SeriesScanOperator, SeriesScanOperator], When dop = 3, each SeriesScanOperator will be divided into a child pipeline. However, the second SeriesScanOperator related pipeline can't run until DeviceViewOperator invoke its isBlocked method, which violate our expectation.
Therefore, I suggest to allow the following child pipeline to run in advance.

title: [To rel/1.0][IOTDB-5189][IOTDB-5529]Optimize the memory usage and execution of fast compaction
body: In the past, all the chunks that overlap with the current chunk were read into the memory at one time, but now only the chunks that need to be used are read into the memory. For example: in the figure below, first read 1 into the memory, and then read 2 3 4 in sequence. At most two chunks can be stored in the memory at the same time instead of 4 chunks.

title: [IOTDB-4898] Push offset and limit down to ScanOperator if possible
body:
Currently, we locate offset and limit at the root of the operator tree which will cause time cost increasing with offset even if limit is the same.

So, we need to push offset and limit down to ScanOperator if possible, and let ScanOperator use statistics to skip the offset

Design doc: https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/Zql4dPk4Xo0Py9xEPZKcrJcJnIe

title: [IOTDB-5147]Optimize compaction schedule when priority is BALANCE
body:
### The changes in this pr are as follows:
1. Change the size of the `candidateCompactionTaskQueue` from 1000 to 50. The advantage is to avoid tasks blocked in the queue occupying files for a long time, resulting in no files being selected for cross-space compaction. But another impact is that once the number of files is large, because the number of tasks in the queue shrinks, the inner-space compaction will not be able to compact the latest files.
2. Priority comparison of tasks: Inner-space compaction tasks no longer distinguish between seq and unseq, but are sorted according to unified rules; under the configuration of BALANCE, cross-space compaction tasks and inner-space compaction tasks follow the first-come-first-executed rule . One thing to note is that since the priority sorting of the queue is implemented through the minimum heap sorting, and each task is not in partial order, the actual result is not strictly that the one with the smaller seriesID will be executed first.

title: [IOTDB-5517] Add metrics for disk io
body:
First PR for this issue is https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/9054.

In the previous code, the disk sector size was set to a fixed 512 bytes length. In practice, however, some disks may have a sector size of 4096 bytes (such as some SSDS or large-capacity HDDS). Instead of setting the disk's sector size to a fixed 512 bytes, this PR gets the disk sector size at startup by looking at the /sys/ block/ [DEV]/queue/hw_sector_size file.

title: [IOTDB-5081] Implement model management on ConfigNode
[IOTDB-5549] Ensure concurrently MNode memory release
body: ## Description The current memory release uses an asynchronous producer-consumer model. A single consumer (release processor) may process multiple requests from producers at once. However, in concurrent scenarios there may be a problem of missed consumption. For example, thread B has performed a memory release but has not set the flag bit hasReleaseTask to false. At this time, thread A checks memory usage and finds that the release threshold has been exceeded, but hasReleaseTask is true and no new threads will be requested to release memory. Although memory will be freed correctly at the next ensureMemoryStatus, the memory occupation at this point is not as expected. Here are two CI tests that reflect this problem: https://github.com/apache/iotdb/actions/runs/4192942086/jobs/7269183098 https://github.com/apache/iotdb/actions/runs/4189919462/jobs/7262793198 ## Solution Use two long live threads to act as ReleaseTask and FlushTask monitor, and use semaphores to control wake-up and sleep. * When the thread hangs, no cpu resources are consumed. * When a task arrives, the thread is woken up and consumed.

title: [IOTDB-5546] Allow consumeAllOperator to run when only some of children is blocked
body: For example, TimeJoinOperator - [SeriesScanOperator, ExchangeOperator], TimeJoinOperator can't run until there is data ready in ExchangeOperator. But acutally, it can run SeriesScanOperator once, and store the result. When ExchangeOperator is ready, it can do the join logic without waiting SeriesScanOperator. Therefore, I suggest to allow consumeAllOperator to run when only some of children is blocked. The part of performance test is as follows: Before the PR, the performance of aggregation query is like: Each line represents the number of series included in query, from 1 to 16. The x axis represents dop and y axis represents time cost. After this PR, the performance of aggregation query is like:
